Title: OATP1B3 (699G>A) and CYP2C9*2, *3 significantly influenced the transport and metabolism of glibenclamide and glipizide
RNAi modulation of placental sFLT1 for the treatment of preeclampsia
Summary: Preeclampsia, a hypertension condition with no approved therapies, is treated in monkeys by gene silencing in the placenta.

Title: ONECUT2 is a targetable master regulator of lethal prostate cancer that suppresses the androgen axis
Summary: ONECUT2 is a targetable transcription factor that antagonizes androgen receptor signaling and drives androgen independence and neuroendocrine differentiation in castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Title: Cell specific delivery of modified mRNA expressing therapeutic proteins to leukocytes
Summary: Therapeutic alteration of protein expression using modified mRNA is limited by immunogenicity and instability in vivo. Here the authors use antibody-coated lipid nanoparticles to deliver mRNA to leukocytes and drive expression of anti-inflammatory cytokines in an inflammatory bowel disease mouse model.

Title: Ligand binding to human prostaglandin E receptor EP4 at the lipid-bilayer interface
Summary: The structure of human prostaglandin E receptor EP4 in complex with antagonist ONO-AE3-208 and a functional antibody reveals a ligand-binding site at the interface of the lipid bilayer that is unique among GPCRs.

Title: A phenotypic Caenorhabditis elegans screen identifies a selective suppressor of antipsychotic-induced hyperphagia
Summary: The molecular pathway(s) driving antipsychotics (AP) induced hyperphagia remains unclear. A novel C. elegans system is used here to screen for FDA approved drugs that selectively suppresses this response, unraveling potential molecular mediators influencing AP induced hyperphagia in mouse models.

Title: Semisynthesis and antibacterial activities of nidulin derivatives
Monitoring drug nanocarriers in human blood by near-infrared fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Summary: While nanocarrier-based drug delivery is a promising therapeutic approach, in situ characterization of drug nanocarriers in blood remains difficult. Here, the authors demonstrate how the fluorescence correlation spectroscopy can be used to directly characterize drug nanocarriers in flowing blood.

Title: Multidirectional desymmetrization of pluripotent building block en route to diastereoselective synthesis of complex nature-inspired scaffolds
Summary: Methods enabling the synthesis of diverse collections of nature-inspired compounds with potential medicinal use are sought after in drug design. Here, the authors report a build/couple/pair strategy to efficiently construct chiral polycyclic scaffolds and show their diversification for drug discovery screening.

Title: Inhalation of the prodrug PI3K inhibitor CL27c improves lung function in asthma and fibrosis
Summary: Activation of PI3K plays a role in pulmonary inflammation. Here, the authors develop a drug inhibitor of PI3K, and show that it inhibits lung inflammation and damage in mouse models of asthma and lung fibrosis.
